hello: if a package is in the debian archive can ubuntu users access it, or must it also be in the universe repo?
a .deb can be installed locally, yes.  As long as the dependencies and stuff work

Yes, debian has repositories like ubuntu.  No, they aren't linked (an ubuntu user doesn't use debian repositories).  Binary compatability isn't guarenteed (you can't grab a debian package and install it on ubuntu), but does *sometimes* work.  Purely coincidentally.
